SOCW4016.title: Social Work Honours Advanced Practice Portfolio
SOCW4016.description: The Social Work Honours Advanced Practice Portfolio is based on a sustained, in-depth study of social work practice.
SOCW4016.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOCW4017.title: Social Work Practice Level 4 Placement A
SOCW4017.description: Your final placement allows you to apply theoretical and skills based learning in a practice setting.

SOCW4018.description: Your final placement allows you to bring together theoretical and skills based learning in a practice setting.
SOCW4018.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOLA1070.title: Sustainable Energy
SOLA1070.description: Students will be introduced to the central concepts of energy and sustainability with a particular focus on sustainable energy systems through their use of the multiplayer PlayEnergy online simulation/game.
SOLA1070.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA2051.title: Project in Photovoltaics and Renewable Energy 1
SOLA2051.description: SOLA2051 is the first of two sequential courses that comprise the second year group project.
SOLA2051.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA2052.title: Project in Photovoltaics and Renewable Energy 2
SOLA2052.description: SOLA2052 is the second of two sequential courses that comprise the second year group project.

SOLA2053.title: Sustainable and Renewable Energy Technologies
SOLA2053.description: This course includes an introduction to issues in sustainable and renewable energy, including environmental impact, resource depletion, basic engineering economic analysis, embodied energy, payback times and the integration of renewable energy sources with conventional infrastructure.
SOLA2053.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA2060.title: Introduction to Electronic Devices
SOLA2060.description: Fundamentals of the operation and applications of a range of important semiconductor devices.
SOLA2060.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA2540.title: Applied Photovoltaics
SOLA2540.description: Can we continue to use fossil fuels for electricity? Think about climate change, global warming, and sustainable economy! Photovoltaic (PV) devices convert sunlight directly to electricity with low levels of greenhouse gas emissions per unit of electricity produced.
SOLA2540.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA3010.title: Low Energy Buildings and Photovoltaics
SOLA3010.description: There is currently significant interest in reducing energy use and greenhouse gas production in buildings by designing buildings that are climate-appropriate, implementing energy efficiency measures and producing energy from renewable sources.
SOLA3010.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA3020.title: Photovoltaic Technology and Manufacturing
SOLA3020.description: Sufficient theory relating to the operating principles of solar cells is covered to give an appreciation of the strengths and weaknesses of the dominant commercial cell technologies.
SOLA3020.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA3507.title: Solar Cells
SOLA3507.description: In this course, students will gain both a fundamental and practical understanding of the design and operation of solar cells.
SOLA3507.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA4012.title: Photovoltaic Systems Design
SOLA4012.description: There is increasing need in generating electricity from renewable energy sources and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
SOLA4012.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA4910.title: Thesis Part A
SOLA4910.description: The Thesis Project is carried out in the last two sessions of the BE program.

SOLA4911.title: Thesis Part B
SOLA4911.description: The Thesis Project (Parts A and B) is carried out in the last two sessions of the BE degree course for full-time students.

SOLA4951.title: Research Thesis A
SOLA4951.description: The thesis provides an opportunity for you to bring together engineering principles learned over your previous years of study and apply these principles to innovatively solve problems such as the development of a specific design, process and/or the investigation of a hypothesis.
SOLA4951.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA4952.title: Research Thesis B
SOLA4952.description: The thesis provides an opportunity for you to bring together engineering principles learned over your previous years of study and apply these principles to innovatively solve problems such as the development of a specific design, process and/or the investigation of a hypothesis.
SOLA4952.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA4953.title: Research Thesis C
SOLA4953.description: The thesis provides an opportunity for you to bring together engineering principles learned over your previous years of study and apply these principles to innovatively solve problems such as the development of a specific design, process and/or the investigation of a hypothesis.
SOLA4953.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5050.title: Renewable Energy Policy
SOLA5050.description: This course will review objectives and strategies of renewable energy policy, focussing on sustainable energy transitions, and the integration of renewable energy into electricity markets.
SOLA5050.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5051.title: Life Cycle Assessment
SOLA5051.description: This course will deal with life cycle analysis and its use for life cycle assessment of energy systems.
SOLA5051.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5052.title: Biomass
SOLA5052.description: This course will introduce a range of biomass energy sources, including forestry, wastes and crops, as well as various technologies for their conversion into useful fuels or power.
SOLA5052.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5053.title: Wind Energy Converters
SOLA5053.description: This course will cover the principles of wind energy and wind power, as well as the design and operation of different types of wind energy converters.
SOLA5053.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5054.title: Photovoltaic Stand-Alone System Design and Installation
SOLA5054.description: This course will allow students to obtain their Business Council for Sustainable Energy (BSCE) (formally SEIAA), provisional accreditation to design and install stand alone power systems.
SOLA5054.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5055.title: Semiconductor Photovoltaic and Photonic Devices
SOLA5055.description: This course describes the operating principles of modern semiconductor devices, relates terminal properties to their internal structure, and gives an understanding of how terminal properties will change with operating conditions.
SOLA5055.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5056.title: Sustainable Energy for Developing Countries
SOLA5056.description: This course covers many of the technical and non-technical issues relating to introducing photovoltaics and renewable energy systems and technology in developing countries.
SOLA5056.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5057.title: Energy Efficiency
SOLA5057.description: If Australia and the world are to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, both renewable energy and more efficient use of that energy will be required.
SOLA5057.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5508.title: High Efficiency Silicon Solar Cells
SOLA5508.description: This is an advanced level subject for those with a good background in semiconductor device physics and an interest in silicon solar cells or related devices.
SOLA5508.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOLA5509.title: Fundamentals of Photovoltaic Materials Processing
SOLA5509.description: This course is offered to undergraduate students as an introduction to photovoltaic materials processing.
SOLA5509.school: School of Photovoltaic and Renewable Engineering

SOMA1001.title: Media Arts Gateway 1
SOMA1001.description: SOMA1001 Media Arts Gateway 1 is an introductory course for students in the Bachelor of Media Arts.
SOMA1001.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2408.title: Time, Mass and Motion in Analogue and Digital Animation
SOMA2408.description:
What is the relationship between time and mass and the creation of animated movement? How do time and mass relate to one another to create a visual language instantly understood merely by the shaping of time through animation? 
In this course you will investigate the concepts of 'time envelopes' which are a unit of movement that has been shaped to express the intention and consciousness of a character or natural phenomena.
SOMA2408.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2409.title: Animated Worlds
SOMA2409.description: Animated Worlds offers a practical introduction to the fundamental aspects of creating a sense of 'worlds' through the creation and manipulation of moving environments.
SOMA2409.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2410.title: The 3D Animated Body
SOMA2410.description: The 3D Animated Body will expose you to the sculptural space of 3D CGI computer animation in order to explore virtual movement, constructed timing and animated object agency.
SOMA2410.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2411.title: CGI Lens Laboratory
SOMA2411.description: The use of CGI (Computer Generated Imagery) and VFX (Visual Effects) is no longer exclusive to its cinematic origins.
SOMA2411.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2412.title: Video Document
SOMA2412.description: Video Document is an introductory video production course that aims to develop fundamental skills in creating video documentaries, while engaging with issues around accuracy, authority, editorial and the manufacture of belief.
SOMA2412.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2413.title: Sound Foundations
SOMA2413.description: Sound Foundations is an introductory Level 2 course in the Bachelor Of Media Arts (Hons).
SOMA2413.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2414.title: Foundations of Digital Imaging
SOMA2414.description: Foundations of Digital Imaging aims to develop your skills and critical knowledge in the fundamentals of digital imaging practice, providing guided experimentation with concepts related to image composite and construction.
SOMA2414.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2415.title: Narrative Structures in Moving Image
SOMA2415.description:
Narrative Structures in Moving Image 
introduces the history and practice of storytelling, 
especially in video and sound production.
SOMA2415.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2416.title: Video Mapping into Sculptural Objects and 3D Spaces
SOMA2416.description: Video Mapping into Sculptural Objects and 3D Spaces is a studio course that considers video projection as an art form.
SOMA2416.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2417.title: Sound Installation and Soundscape
SOMA2417.description: Sound Installation and Soundscape is an elective course in which you will focus on the conception, capture and composition of sound structures that engage with space, objects and scenarios in installation and performative contexts.

SOMA2481.title: Future Screen: Practices of Speculative Media
SOMA2481.description: SOMA2481 Future Screen studies recent and historical examples of science fiction cinema and related critical discourses.
SOMA2481.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2605.title: Lighting
SOMA2605.description: This course focuses on lighting the digital environment and is designed to explore the role in relation to digital production in particular.
SOMA2605.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2815.title: Introduction to Digital Imaging
SOMA2815.description: In this studio workshop the student is introduced to the basic concepts and future possibilities of digital imaging processes.
SOMA2815.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2816.title: Introduction to Motion Capture
SOMA2816.description: This undergraduate elective course introduces you to Motion capture (mocap) technology that digitally captures human movement as data for use in film, animation, visual effects, and games production as well as experimentation in media and creative disciplines relevant to your self-determined career practice.
SOMA2816.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2818.title: Media Apps and Digital Publication
SOMA2818.description: Media Apps and Digital Publication is designed for Art & Design students, particularly those involved in screen production, seeking to present their work in new media spaces.
SOMA2818.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA2863.title: Media Art in Asia
SOMA2863.description: Media Art in Asia is an elective course that explores contemporary media  art practices and innovation in Asian visual cultures.
SOMA2863.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3408.title: Animation Processes: Preproduction to Post
SOMA3408.description: Animation Processes: Preproduction to Post offers an indepth exploration of the complete cycle of animation processes using a range of materials, data and digital technologies to create a short self-contained animated project reflecting an inventive approach to process.
SOMA3408.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3409.title: Deconstructed Animation Systems
SOMA3409.description: In Deconstructed Animation Systems you will investigate how animation systems have developed and what  they say about how we see time, movement, and states of change.

SOMA3410.title: Performative Animation and the Virtual Body
SOMA3410.description: Performative Animation and the Virtual Body will help you to bring your animated characters to life.
SOMA3410.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3411.title: Visual Effects Project
SOMA3411.description: In the Visual Effects Project you will examine how CGI and Visual Effects (VFX) strategies are used to realize ideas not easily documented in other media forms, such as video or photography.
SOMA3411.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3412.title: Critiques of Narrative in Moving Image
SOMA3412.description: In Critiques of Narrative in Moving Image you will creatively critique the rules and limitations put forward by screen industry practice, considering whether breaking the rules has more efficacy when the paradigm is in place.
SOMA3412.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3413.title: Audiovisual Studio
SOMA3413.description: In this course, you will explore the role of sound design in constructing screen-based audiovisual work, looking at how the overall soundtrack acts as a storytelling component from preproduction to post-production in video and animation.
SOMA3413.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3414.title: Rethinking Sound and Music
SOMA3414.description: In Rethinking Sound and Music you will produce original sound/music works drawing on analysis of traditionally separated histories, genres and definitions of sound and music.
SOMA3414.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3415.title: Compositional Project
SOMA3415.description: Compositional Project draws together your learning in sound, video and image production to experiment with and master individual approaches to visual and sonic composition.
SOMA3415.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3416.title: Imaging Effects Workshop
SOMA3416.description: Imaging Effects Workshop draws together skills and learning in digital imaging, composition and motion graphics to introduce a coherent practice in visual effects.
SOMA3416.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMA3417.title: Virtual Control Systems and 3D Surfaces
SOMA3417.description: Moving virtual objects in 3D spaces require specialised design approaches and complex applied processes.

SOMA3616.title: Professional Practice
SOMA3616.description: This course will provide students with a range of strategies and skills that will prepare them for working in a dynamic fluid industry.

SOMA3801.title: Special Project
SOMA3801.description: This course allows students to undertake a Special Project as part of their academic program.
SOMA3801.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOMS1501.title: Inside the Criminal Mind
SOMS1501.description: Serial killers, psychopaths, violent, and sexual offenders receive significant attention in the media, creating a particular fascination for people; they also consume significant resources in terms of their policing, prosecution, treatment, and punishment.

SOMS3001.title: School of Medical Sciences Research Internship
SOMS3001.description: Short theoretical or experimental research project, supervised by a member of academic staff.

SOMS3050.title: Industry Engagement, Problem-solving and Employment Skills
SOMS3050.description: This Real-world Industry Engagement and Employment Skills course is linked with external agencies, industries and businesses who provide projects to teams of students to work on.

SOMS3232.title: Cellular Mechanisms of Health and Disease
SOMS3232.description: This course in molecular medicine bridges the gap between the fundamental sciences of cell biology/biochemistry/immunology and their therapeutic applications.

SOMS4001.title: School of Medical Sciences Honours (Full Time)
SOMS4001.description: The School of Medical Sciences Honours course is run over two semesters.

SOMS4002.title: School of Medical Sciences Honours (Part-time)
SOMS4002.description: The School of Medical Sciences Honours course is run over four semesters.

SOMS4884.title: School of Medical Sciences Honours Part-Time
SOMS4884.description: The School of Medical Sciences Honours course is run part-time over six terms.

SOMS4888.title: School of Medical Sciences Honours (Full Time) (UG)
SOMS4888.description: The School of Medical Sciences Honours course is run over three terms.

SOSS1000.title: Policy and Society
SOSS1000.description: This course explores the nature of the applied social sciences and provides information about how social science can be applied to real world problems.
SOSS1000.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOSS1001.title: Social Research and Society
SOSS1001.description: This course introduces the methods and processes available to social scientists in researching in the social world.
SOSS1001.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOSS2001.title: Qualitative Social Research
SOSS2001.description: In this course you will examine the various components of qualitative research.
SOSS2001.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOSS3001.title: Quantitative Social Research
SOSS3001.description: The ability to conduct high quality quantitative research is a valuable skill for social scientists and applied social researchers.
SOSS3001.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOSS3002.title: Social Research and Policy Project
SOSS3002.description: How can social research be used to influence and change policy? In this course, you will undertake a social science research project in one of several policy areas.
SOSS3002.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOSS3003.title: Policy Analysis
SOSS3003.description: This course asks what are some concrete ways to contribute to and influence policy? In this course, you will gain experience in dealing with 'real world' policy problems through a series of case studies on topics drawn from current policy issues.
SOSS3003.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SOSS3006.title: Social Research and Policy in the Workplace
SOSS3006.description: SRAP3006 is core course for students enrolled in the Bachelor of Social Research and Policy (BSRP) program.
SOSS3006.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SRAP4051.title: Social Research and Policy Honours
SRAP4051.description: A 6 UOC thesis in Social Research and Policy to be completed as part of the 30 UOC of thesis component in the Honours Program.
SRAP4051.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SRAP4052.title: Social Research and Policy Honours
SRAP4052.description: A 12 UOC thesis in Social Research and Policy to be completed as part of the 30 UOC of thesis component in the Honours Program.
SRAP4052.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

SRAP4053.title: Social Research and Policy Honours
SRAP4053.description: An 18 UOC thesis in Social Research and Policy to be completed as part of the 30 UOC of thesis component in the Honours Program.
SRAP4053.faculty: Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture

TABL1003.title: Microeconomics and the Australian Tax System
TABL1003.description: This course provides an introduction to basic microeconomic concepts and skills, and demonstrates their use in order to gain a clear understanding of economic problems and policy issues relevant to the Australian economy.
TABL1003.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL1005.title: Accounting 1
TABL1005.description: This is the first course in a sequence of courses dealing with the profession and the practice of accounting and the literature associated with it.
TABL1005.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL1006.title: Tax Administrative Law
TABL1006.description: This course focuses on the key policy and practical aspects of the administration of the Commonwealth's 'self-assessment' income taxation regime.
TABL1006.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL1010.title: Accounting 2
TABL1010.description: This course is complementary to TABL1005 Accounting 1, and completes the preparation of the financial reports using the Australian regulatory requirements.
TABL1010.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL1011.title: Macroeconomics, Government and the Economy
TABL1011.description: Macroeconomics is the study of the economic performance of nations and the effectiveness of policies that governments use to try to improve that performance.
TABL1011.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL1710.title: Business and the Law
TABL1710.description: All students taking this course during Summer Term will be required to pay full tuition fees.

TABL2015.title: Intermediate Financial Accounting
TABL2015.description: This course is concerned with external financial reporting and, in particular, the accounting and reporting practices of listed companies.
TABL2015.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL2053.title: Accounting for Complex Structures and Instruments
TABL2053.description: This course is concerned with the accounting issues posed by complex financial transactions and organisational structures.
TABL2053.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL2057.title: Business Finance
TABL2057.description: Business Finance is an introductory course in financial management.
TABL2057.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL2058.title: Quantitative Analysis
TABL2058.description: Quantitative Analysis is an introductory course in mathematical and statistical concepts and techniques with applications in commerce and taxation.
TABL2058.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL2059.title: Management Accounting
TABL2059.description: Management accounting systems are designed to provide managers in all types of organisations with information to assist them in decision making, planning and control.
TABL2059.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL2060.title: Auditing and Assurance Services
TABL2060.description: This course examines the practice of auditing and the concepts which underlie the practice.
TABL2060.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL2712.title: Business Ethics and the Law
TABL2712.description: Society increasingly demands ethical and social responsibilty.

TABL2721.title: Business Law in Action
TABL2721.description: Law forms the basis of all business transactions and is essential to their proper understanding.

TABL2731.title: Marketing and Distribution Law
TABL2731.description: The marketing and distribution of goods and services operates within a comprehensive regulatory framework.

TABL2732.title: Franchising
TABL2732.description: Franchising is a dominant business strategy for the distribution of goods and services both domestically and internationally.

TABL2741.title: Business Entities
TABL2741.description: The law relating to the legal structures available for business including partnerships, joint ventures, trusts and companies.

TABL2751.title: Business Taxation
TABL2751.description: The complexity and comprehensiveness of the Australian taxation system demands that tax considerations must be taken into account in most business decisions.
TABL2751.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL2756.title: International Business Tax
TABL2756.description: This course discusses the principles relevant to international taxation and uses Australian international tax rules to highlight possible international tax policy choices and problems.
TABL2756.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL2790.title: Legal Environment of Asian Business
TABL2790.description: In the era of globalisation and of rapid growth of Asian economies the corporate world increasingly requires commerce graduates to have a general understanding of how business is conducted within different commercial legal frameworks in Asia.

TABL2792.title: Real Property Law
TABL2792.description: Recognition of the significance of different land titles, tenures and interests in land; understand the construction and content of contracts, leases and other forms of agreement required for property dealings and use; develop a familiarity with public and private controls and restrictions on land use and development; appreciate the relationship between planning policies at all levels and the valuation process; a knowledge of the valuation review and determination processes of the Land and Environment Court and similar tribunals; acquire a familiarity with major court cases, relevant to the valuer, which establish valuation principles; understand the major objectives of principal New South Wales Acts dealing with real estate or interests therein.

TABL2793.title: People and the Environmental Challenge
TABL2793.description: The purpose of this course is to provide students with a systematic and critical examination of people and the environmental challenge.
TABL2793.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3003.title: Taxation of Corporations
TABL3003.description: The company remains the most widely used vehicle for the collective investment of capital.

TABL3005.title: Taxation of Trusts
TABL3005.description: The trust is a major form of vehicle used for holding investment assets, for transferring family wealth to future generations and for income splitting.

TABL3006.title: Tax Litigation
TABL3006.description: This course deals with the practical operation of the rule making and dispute resolution in the Australian tax system.

TABL3007.title: Taxation of Corporate Finance
TABL3007.description: In this course you will be exposed to corporate finance concepts, as well as an in-depth examination of core tax law issues in the area, such as debt financing and timing.
TABL3007.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3010.title: Taxation of Superannuation
TABL3010.description: This course provides a general introduction to the taxation of superannuation in Australia, in particular to the main types of superannuation funds and how their income is taxed, the treatment of contributions to those funds, and the taxation of benefits paid on retirement or termination of employment.

TABL3016.title: Critical Perspectives and Ethics
TABL3016.description: The primary aim of this course is to encourage students to consider the moral and ethical roles and responsibilities of the various participants in the taxation system.

TABL3020.title: Principles of Australian International Taxation
TABL3020.description: This course provides a broad overview of the most important elements of Australian tax law as it affects international transactions (whether involving the movement of funds, of property or of people).

TABL3022.title: GST: Design and Structure
TABL3022.description: This course explores the economic and policy issues which underlie and drive GST.
TABL3022.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3023.title: Principles of Goods and Services Tax Law
TABL3023.description: The object of this course is to provide high level conceptual and analytical knowledge of GST appropriate to the practical requirements of business, legal and accounting advisers working with GST on a regular basis.

TABL3025.title: Taxation of Employee Remuneration
TABL3025.description: The provision of personal services for payment is a major economic activity in Australia, and such services are not always provided under the traditional employment contract.
TABL3025.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3026.title: Taxation and Investment Regulation in China
TABL3026.description: This course provides comprehensive coverage of the tax system and investment regulation in China in the context of common business, investment and employment activities.

TABL3028.title: International Tax: Design and Structure
TABL3028.description: This course addresses the fundamental building blocks of those parts of domestic income tax systems that deal with cross border investment and income flows.
TABL3028.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3031.title: Principles of Revenue Administration
TABL3031.description: This course will provide essential core material on the principles that underpin the administration of tax authorities around the world.
TABL3031.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3033.title: Tax Clinic
TABL3033.description: The Tax Clinic run by the UNSW School of Taxation & Business Law is an experiential, Work Integrated Learning (WIL) course.
TABL3033.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3040.title: Self Managed Superannuation Funds Law
TABL3040.description: Self managed superannuation funds are growing at an exponential rate.

TABL3044.title: Comparative Tax Systems
TABL3044.description: The course provides students with a comparative overview of the tax systems of various countries, with a view to developing a conceptual and practical understanding of the reasons why tax systems differ (and why they are sometimes so similar).

TABL3055.title: Taxation of Property Transactions
TABL3055.description: Property transactions are one of the most common and significant dealings forming a large part of just about every Federal and State tax base.
TABL3055.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3732.title: International Franchise Law
TABL3732.description: Franchising at the international level is a highly practical entry point to international and global commerce.

TABL3741.title: Insolvency Law
TABL3741.description: The purpose of this course is to examine the main principles of insolvency law.

TABL3752.title: Capital Gains Tax
TABL3752.description: Capital Gains Tax in Australia potentially applies to an exceptionally wide range of transactions.
TABL3752.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3755.title: Taxation of Business Entities
TABL3755.description: Even though considerable economic activity in Australia is undertaken through the sole trader (sole owner) “entity”, significant economic activity takes place through use of the three major entities, namely, the partnership, trust and company vehicle.
TABL3755.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3757.title: Corporate Tax Strategy
TABL3757.description: What are the tax implications of the different financing alternatives available to corporations? Are all the different methods of profit distribution from a company equally tax effective? How should a merger or a demerger be structured from a tax perspective? Why are the tax consequences of restructuring the capital of corporations? What are the implications of the tax consolidation provisions for corporate groups? What tax considerations might be relevant when undertaking a corporate restructuring? This course will examine corporate law and tax issues involved in these and similar questions through a series of case studies and simulation games.
TABL3757.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL3761.title: Law of Banking and Finance
TABL3761.description: This course examines the legal and regulatory environment for banking and finance in Australia.

TABL3781.title: Intellectual Property for Business
TABL3781.description: Innovation is a key driver of business.

TABL3791.title: International Business Law
TABL3791.description: Business today increasingly operates in an international market place.

TABL4600.title: Thesis A
TABL4600.description: Honours students complete a thesis under the direction of a supervisor.
TABL4600.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL4601.title: Thesis B
TABL4601.description: Honours students complete a thesis under the direction of a supervisor.
TABL4601.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL4602.title: Thesis C
TABL4602.description: Honours students complete a thesis under the direction of a supervisor.
TABL4602.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL4721.title: Special Topic in Business Law
TABL4721.description: An in-depth piece of research on a specific area of business law, with the topic to be approved by the academic supervising the project.

TABL4722.title: Special Topic in Taxation
TABL4722.description: An in-depth piece of research on a specific area of taxation, with the topic to be approved by the academic supervising the project.
TABL4722.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL5805.title: Research Methods in Taxation and Business Law
TABL5805.description: This course provides an introduction to the research process and analytical skills with particular reference to tax and business law research.
TABL5805.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TABL5810.title: Dissertation Proposal
TABL5810.description: This course will instruct and guide students in the appropriate preparation and presentation of their proposed thesis and will assist them in identifying their research questions and the methodologies to be used.
TABL5810.school: School of Accounting, Auditing and Taxation

TELE3113.title: Analogue and Digital Communications
TELE3113.description: Telecommunication Fundamentals: Free space propagation characteristics, phasors, fourier transform, spectrum analysis, random signals.

TELE3117.title: Telecommunications Engineering Design
TELE3117.description: Design Project Management: Introduction to scheduling, costing, marketing, standards, patents, quality, safety, (electronic) manufacturing methods, engineering innovation, Report Writing and Oral Presentations.

TELE3118.title: Network Technologies
TELE3118.description: Network architectures in terms of topology, role (client/server, peer-to-peer), and layered specification.

TELE3119.title: Trusted Networks
TELE3119.description: CRYPTOGRAPHY: (i) Symmetric Encryption and Message Confidentiality, (ii) Public-Key Cryptography and Message Authentication, (iii) Key Distribution, (iv) Mathematical Principles of Cryptography.

TELE4120.title: Thesis Part A - (Telecommunications)
TELE4120.description: The thesis project topic area chosen by the student may be in any technical area covered by the interests and expertise of the academic staff of the School who will act as the project supervisors.

TELE4121.title: Thesis - Part B (Telecommunications Engineering)
TELE4121.description: The project may require design and construction of laboratory equipment or hardware, development and use of computer software, experiments and teaching associated with these.

TELE4123.title: Telecommunications Design Proficiency
TELE4123.description: The course involves four competency components, as follows:Electronic Circuit Design: Devices, amplifiers, tuned circuits, opamp circuits, etc.

TELE4642.title: Network Performance
TELE4642.description: This course aims to develop an understanding of the tools and technologies for understanding and improving the performance of communication networks such as the Internet.

TELE4651.title: Wireless Communication Technologies
TELE4651.description: Wireless Communications Channels: time-variant multipath fading, Doppler shift, fade rate, shadowing effect, time selective channel, frequency selective channel, the effects of fading on wireless transmission, performance analysis.

TELE4652.title: Mobile and Satellite Communications Systems
TELE4652.description: Introduction to Mobile Communications: historical development of mobile telephony.

TELE4653.title: Digital Modulation and Coding
TELE4653.description: Communication concepts: Fourier transforms, random signals, Transmitter and receiver filters, matched filter, Nyquist criterion.

VISN1101.title: Seeing the World: Perspectives from Vision Science
VISN1101.description: After completing this course, you will never see the world the same way again.
VISN1101.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN1111.title: Geometrical and Physical Optics
VISN1111.description: Objectives: This course provides an understanding of geometric and physical optics.
VISN1111.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN1221.title: Visual Optics
VISN1221.description: This course builds on knowledge and skills gained in the geometric and physical optics (VISN 1111 course) to the optical characteristics of the human eye in relation to visual performance including errors of refraction and measurement and corrections using fundamental principles of light and optics.
VISN1221.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN2111.title: Ocular Anatomy and Physiology
VISN2111.description: Objectives: An understanding of the anatomy and physiology of the eye, ocular adnexa and surrounds and an introduction to the visual pathways.
VISN2111.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN2211.title: Organisation and Function of the Visual System
VISN2211.description: Objectives: An understanding of processing in the visual system.
VISN2211.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN2231.title: Introduction to Ocular Disease
VISN2231.description: Objectives: An understanding of the basic mechanisms of disease as they relate to the eye.
VISN2231.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN3111.title: Development and Aging of the Visual System
VISN3111.description: Objectives: An understanding of the development and aging of the visual system.
VISN3111.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN3211.title: New Developments in Vision Science
VISN3211.description: Objectives: An understanding of the new developments occurring in vision science.
VISN3211.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN4003.title: Vision Science Honours
VISN4003.description: Students in this course will undertake research under the supervision of an academic in the School of Optometry and Vision Science.
VISN4003.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

VISN4016.title: Vision Science Honours
VISN4016.description: Students in this course will undertake research under the supervision of an academic in the School of Optometry and Vision Science.
VISN4016.school: School of Optometry and Vision Science

YMED1001.title: Introduction to Population Health
YMED1001.description: This course, offered by Arizona State University under the PLuS Alliance, serves as an introduction to the basic principles in community and public health, core functions of public health, role of government and non-government agencies, and health policies affecting populations.

YMED1002.title: College Mathematics
YMED1002.description: This course is designed to strengthen the student's foundation in quantitative reasoning and understanding of basic math, elementary algebra, sets, probability, statistics, finance, and geometry.

YMED1003.title: General Biology
YMED1003.description: The course covers the topics of cell biology, molecular biology, metabolism, and physiology of selected tissue and organ systems.

YMED1004.title: Human Anatomy and Physiology 1
YMED1004.description: This course covers the study of the structure and function of the human body.

YMED1005.title: Introduction to Anatomy and Physiology
YMED1005.description: Students will become conversant in the terminology and essential concepts in human anatomy and physiology, and the structure and function of the human body.

YMED1006.title: Human Anatomy and Physiology 2
YMED1006.description: YMED1006 is the second semester of the study of structure and function of the human body.

YMED1008.title: Introduction to Global Health
YMED1008.description: What makes us sick? How can we promote health? These are big questions that are necessarily global in scope.

YMED3001.title: Health Care Legislation
YMED3001.description: The focus of this course is to provide an overview of the federal/state health policy legislative process, how it is implemented in institutions, and its effect on health science professionals and delivery of services.

YMED3002.title: Evaluation of Health Sciences Research
YMED3002.description: This course investigates methods of inquiry in health sciences and techniques for critiquing and interpreting research within the context of evidence-based practice.

YMED3003.title: Environmental Community Health
YMED3003.description: This course examines the interdependent relationship between the health of the environment and the health of communities.

YMED3004.title: Behavioural and Mental Disorders
YMED3004.description: This course introduces common co-occurring mental and behavioral health issues related to patients’ chronic medical conditions and evidence-based assessment strategies to address behavioral health needs in primary care and other medical settings.

YMED3005.title: Economics for Health Majors
YMED3005.description: This course introduces economics and demonstrates the relevance of economic principles to the study of health care delivery systems and public health.

YMED3006.title: Comparative Health Systems
YMED3006.description: This course introduces students to the principles and practice of health system analysis, the sources and utilisation of information relating to health services, and frameworks for assessing health systems performance.

YMED3007.title: Environmental and Occupational Health
YMED3007.description: This course examines the major environmental health issues facing our global environment in the 21st century, important concepts of environmental health, the range of factors impacting upon global environmental health, key environmental hazards posing risks to human health and safety, and several programmes and policies in place to address environmental health issues.

ZBUS1101.title: Organisational Behaviour
ZBUS1101.description: Organisations are a permanent aspect of our current social system.

ZBUS1102.title: Business Economics
ZBUS1102.description: The course introduces you to the main principles of economics.

ZBUS1103.title: Introduction to Accounting
ZBUS1103.description: The course aims to provide business students with an understanding of how financial information is used for decision making and to create a picture of an organisation.

ZBUS1104.title: Foundations of Management
ZBUS1104.description: This course is the first of three, comprising the Integrating Core in the BBus degree.

ZBUS2101.title: Business Law
ZBUS2101.description: This course aims to provide a general understanding of the law and legal processes operating within a private or public business context.

ZBUS2202.title: Australia and the World Economy
ZBUS2202.description: In this course, the understanding of macroeconomics gained in the course Business Economics is extended by developing models used to analyse open-economy macroeconomic fluctuations and policies.

ZBUS2206.title: Managing People Across Cultures
ZBUS2206.description: Managing People Across Cultures is an elective in the management stream of the Bachelor of Business.

ZBUS2207.title: Governing Australia: Managing the Public Sector
ZBUS2207.description: The course focuses on strategic level management of the Australian public sector and comprehends setting objectives, planning implementation and marshalling resources.

ZBUS2208.title: Innovation and Organisation
ZBUS2208.description: Organisations are continually striving to develop their innovation capabilities, skills and culture.

ZBUS2302.title: Leadership
ZBUS2302.description: This course considers leadership as a management activity and includes critical analysis of the assumptions underlying leadership.

ZBUS2304.title: Management Accounting
ZBUS2304.description: This course develops an understanding of management accounting with a view to equip students with the ability to address costing and budgeting issues in a complex organisational environment.

ZBUS2401.title: Financial Management
ZBUS2401.description: This course deals with investment evaluation and finance.

ZBUS2820.title: International Business
ZBUS2820.description: This course introduces students to key theories and concepts of business and business activities in a regional and international context.

ZBUS2901.title: Business Research
ZBUS2901.description: Students will undertake a research project commensurate with Year 2 study, supported by a supervisor.

ZBUS2902.title: Research Project in Business 1
ZBUS2902.description: Students will continue a research project commensurate with Year 2 study, supported by a supervisor.

ZBUS3101.title: Business Law 2
ZBUS3101.description: This course aims to broaden the understanding of the law and legal processes operating within a private or public business context.

ZBUS3102.title: Project Management
ZBUS3102.description: This course identifies the components of project management and its associated management tools and procedures.

ZBUS3103.title: Human Resource Management
ZBUS3103.description: This course introduces students to the theory and practice of Human Resource Management.

ZBUS3104.title: Business Capstone
ZBUS3104.description: This capstone course uses disciplinary concepts and analytical techniques from BBus core courses to solve complex organisational problems.

ZBUS3106.title: Business and Sustainable Development
ZBUS3106.description: This course introduces students to the principles of sustainable development and how they apply to business.

ZBUS3107.title: Illicit Business in the Modern World
ZBUS3107.description: Illicit business is an important area of study because it affects all levels of society.

ZBUS3203.title: The Making of Economic Policy
ZBUS3203.description: This course deals with the process of economic policy making and analyses the rationale for, and implications of, economic policies in open economies.

ZBUS3207.title: Management and Governance in Developing Countries
ZBUS3207.description: This course focuses on the role of the state in developing countries.

ZBUS3208.title: Marketing
ZBUS3208.description: This course introduces a suite of marketing-related ideas.

ZBUS3303.title: Logistics Management
ZBUS3303.description: This course gives an introduction to theories and practices of logistics and supply chain management, with an emphasis on learning and addressing the challenges associated with the movement of people, goods and services.

ZBUS3901.title: Research Project in Business 2
ZBUS3901.description: Students will continue a research project that they commenced in Semester 1 of Year 2.

ZBUS3902.title: Research Project in Business 3
ZBUS3902.description: Students will continue a research project that they commenced in Semester 1 of Year 2.

ZBUS4001.title: Literature Review (Honours)
ZBUS4001.description: The course, ZBUS4001 Literature Review (Honours), is designed to provide students undertaking the 4512 Business (Honours) program with the skills they require to conduct the literature review component of their honours thesis.

ZBUS4002.title: Research Methods (Honours)
ZBUS4002.description: The course, ZBUS4002 Research Methods (Honours), is designed to provide students undertaking the 4512 Business (Honours) program with an understanding of the research methods used in the various business disciplines.

ZBUS4101.title: Business Research 1 (Honours)
ZBUS4101.description: This 12UOC course constitutes one part of the research component of the 4512 Business (Honours) program.

ZBUS4102.title: Business Research 2 (Honours)
ZBUS4102.description: This 24UOC course constitutes one part of the research component of the 4512 Business (Honours) program.

ZEIT1102.title: Introduction to Programming
ZEIT1102.description: Introduction to Programming builds on Computational Programming Solving,  concentrating on computer programming in an object-oriented paradigm.

ZEIT1110.title: Computer Games
ZEIT1110.description: Computer Games takes an IT professional and computational view of the technology and industry of computer games.

ZEIT1190.title: Computing and Cyber Security Research 1A
ZEIT1190.description: This course is restricted to those students undertaking the BCCS (CDF) program.

ZEIT1191.title: Computing and Cyber Security Research 1B
ZEIT1191.description: This course is restricted to those students undertaking the BCCS (CDF) programs.

ZEIT1206.title: Design of Electronic Circuits 1
ZEIT1206.description: Resistance and Ohm's Law; Kirchoff's voltage and current laws; power; simple DC circuits; superposition; Thevenin's theorem; Norton's theorem; node and mesh analysis; dependent sources; electrical measurements; RMS voltages and currents; capacitance and inductance; impedance and admittance; phasors; simple AC circuits, transformers.

ZEIT1208.title: Introduction to Electrical Engineering
ZEIT1208.description: This course introduces a good balance of theory, practice and laboratory investigation.

ZEIT1290.title: Electrical Engineering Research 1A
ZEIT1290.description: This course is available to students in the BE(Elec-CDF) program.

ZEIT1291.title: Electrical Engineering Research 1B
ZEIT1291.description: This course is available to students in the BE (ElecCDF) program.

ZEIT1501.title: Engineering Practice and Design
ZEIT1501.description: This is a foundational course that equips students with the basic concepts of current engineering practice.

ZEIT1503.title: Engineering Mechanics
ZEIT1503.description: This course is a foundation course for many engineering and technology disciplines providing an introduction to both Statics and Dynamics.

ZEIT1504.title: Introduction to Mechanical and Aeronautical Engineering
ZEIT1504.description: This course introduces students to the Mechanical and Aeronautical Engineering disciplines.

ZEIT1600.title: Introduction to Civil Engineering
ZEIT1600.description: This course introduces students to the Civil Engineering discipline and its various specialised fields.

ZEIT1690.title: Civil Engineering Research 1A
ZEIT1690.description: This course is available to students in the BE(Civil)(Hons)(CDF) program.

ZEIT1800.title: Introduction to Aviation Technology
ZEIT1800.description: This course will introduce students to the world of aviation, encompassing both civil and military operations.

ZEIT1901.title: Engineering Research 1A
ZEIT1901.description: This course is restricted to those students undertaking the BE(Aero)(CDF), BE(Civil)(CDF), BE(Mech)(CDF), or BTech(Aero)(CDF) programs.

ZEIT1902.title: Engineering Research 1B
ZEIT1902.description: This course is restricted to those students undertaking the BE(Aero)(CDF), BE(Civil)(CDF), BE(Mech)(CDF), or BTech(Aero)(CDF) programs.

ZEIT2102.title: Computer Technology
ZEIT2102.description: The course presents the fundamental aspects of computing, which include historic views on analogue and biological computing, and then focuses on the most important technologies for digital and neuromorphic computing.

ZEIT2103.title: Data Structures and Representation
ZEIT2103.description: Data Structures and Representation is an intermediate course in computer  programming, that aims to further explore computer program control and  data structures, using Java as the teaching language.

ZEIT2104.title: Computers and Security
ZEIT2104.description: A large part of this course deals with various details of cyber offensive and defensive principles, following the cyber kill chain methodology.

ZEIT2105.title: Systems Analysis and Design
ZEIT2105.description: This course provides a broad exposure to the IT Management, Information System Design, and Principles.

ZEIT2106.title: Digital Forensics
ZEIT2106.description: This course will introduce students to Digital Forensics as part of the evidence and intelligence gathering process.

ZEIT2190.title: Computing and Cyber Security Research 2
ZEIT2190.description: This course is restricted to those students undertaking the BCCS (CDF) program.

ZEIT2207.title: Design of Electronic Circuits 2
ZEIT2207.description: ZEIT2207 focusses on transistors: you will study the analysis, design, and construction of transistor-based circuits.

ZEIT2208.title: Programmable Digital Systems
ZEIT2208.description: Interfacing with the analogue world; Digital-to-Analogue conversion; Analogue-to-Digital conversion.

ZEIT2209.title: Principles of Electrical Engineering
ZEIT2209.description: This 6 unit of credit course will focus on the understanding of principles of electrical engineering.

ZEIT2500.title: Thermofluids
ZEIT2500.description: This course examines the role of thermodynamics and fluid mechanics in engineering.

ZEIT2501.title: Mechanical and Electronic Design
ZEIT2501.description: This course aims to develop sound design practice through participation in the Warman Design and Build Project and Competition, which is a small-group, semester-long, authentic project-based learning activity.

ZEIT2502.title: Fundamentals of Flight
ZEIT2502.description: This course introduces the fundamentals of aerodynamics, aircraft performance and stability.

ZEIT2503.title: Fluid Mechanics
ZEIT2503.description: This course covers fundamental aspects of fluid mechanics.

ZEIT2504.title: Mechanics of Solids
ZEIT2504.description: The mechanical behaviour and analysis of solid objects under various loadings is considered in this course.

ZEIT2601.title: Soil Mechanics and Engineering Geology
ZEIT2601.description: This is an introductory course that addresses: introductory aspects of engineering geology; engineering classification of soils and rocks;  compaction behavior of soil, stresses in soils under self weight and simple loading conditions; 1 D and 2D seepage and their effects on effective stress, and behavior of soils under1 D consolidation.

ZEIT2602.title: Hydraulic Engineering
ZEIT2602.description: This course covers fundamental aspects of fluid mechanics and hydraulics.

ZEIT2603.title: Civil Engineering Materials
ZEIT2603.description: This course is aimed to provide a comprehensive introduction on civil engineering materials.

ZEIT2700.title: Mechanics of Machines
ZEIT2700.description: This course will combine concepts learned in Statics and Dynamics in the context of mechanisms analysis and design.
